snippet: The victory, said to have been led by two foreign men who carried out a suicide attack, was bound to boost the morale of an insurgency that has faltered.
abstract: Rebel fighters take over government air base in northern Syria, seizing several tanks and other munitions and taking soldiers prisoner; victory, said to have been led by two foreign men who carried out suicide attack, is bound to boost morale of insurgency; at same time, government celebrates its own victory in Homs, Syria, where rebel areas had been heavily damaged in fighting.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: C.J. Chivers contributed reporting. Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The victory, said to have been led by two foreign men who carried out a suicide attack, was bound to boost the morale of an insurgency that has faltered.

headline.main: Rebels Gain Control of Government Air Base in Syria
headline.print_headline: Rebels Gain Control of Government Air Base in Syria
